manuscript_citation: Aw WC, Towarnicki SG, Melvin RG, Youngson NA, Garvin MR, Hu Y, Nielsen S, Thomas T, Pickford R, Bustamante S, Vila-Sanjurjo A, Smyth GK, Ballard JWO (2018) Genotype to phenotype: Diet-by-mitochondrial DNA haplotype interactions drive metabolic flexibility and organismal fitness. PLoS Genet 14(11): e1007735. doi: 10.1371/journal.pgen.1007735

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"2cpns","text":"Studies followed https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/private\/90C4D66F3DAF2BEDBF93273D5ED75E1F,\u00a0but the diet was permuted over the 26 generations of the study.\u00a0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4mnqe","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"el4g5","text":"Generations 1-4 were fed 1:2 P:C laboratory diet, 5-20 the 1:16 P:C diet and 21-26 the 1:2 P:C diet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8uio4","text":"Two addition population cage studies were then completed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bouk8","text":"In the first cage study the laboratory diet was replaced with natural fruits.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8vhri","text":"In the second study the two D. melanogaster mitotypes were completed against an inbred line of D. simulans siIII collected by JWOB in east Africa.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":28,"length":15,"style":"italic"},{"offset":95,"length":11,"style":"italic"},{"offset":107,"length":2,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"96e5l","text":"For the population cage and fruit studies, the mtDNA frequency of larvae harbouring Dahomey or Alstonville mtDNA was determined by allele-specific PCR and independently corroborated by Sanger sequencing, as above using the ND4L forward 5\u2019-TAAACAAACTAATCTAACTAATA-3\u2019, reverse 3\u2019-GGTTGTGATATATTATCTTATGG-5\u2019 and reverse 3\u2019-TATATTAATTGGTATTTTTTCTG-5\u2019 primer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8hg9p","text":"The fruit diet was constructed by adding 150 g of passionfruit or banana in a standard base containing 1% agar, 0.1% nipagen, 0.1% propionic acid and 0.001% phosphoric acid. The final volume was set at 300ml.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
